intro: Lappula dielsii, commonly known as Diels' lappula, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a low, spreading growth habit and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Lappula dielsii is often found in steppes and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
